content:
How about we put a working mockup in home page rather than keeping a screenshot? Users can play with Zulip in zulipchat.com home page and get a feel of Zulip.
We don't have to keep the entire UI(probably just the stream sidebar and message viewport. )
Also we can make use of the hotspots to explain what exactly the UI is.
Oh interesting, you mean this, but just have the stream and topic links in the left sidebar work?
Yup. A mockup the same as the screenshot you created but users should be able to interact with it.
cool, that's a great idea. Will work on a draft of it.

I really like that idea. Having said that I do feel that requiring interaction may be more than what is necessary for a user to get the relevant information out of it. I would more favor a 3 - 5 second animated loop showcasing the benefits of the threading model and in the process also showcasing the UI. In general, from a non-demo page, we should aim to minimize the effort it requires for a user to capture the maximum possible information.

On a related note -- I really think there should be a link on the top nav that says Demo. Thats almost immediately the first link I look for when going to a product website and when I don't find one it almost always means I mark that as a negative in my head.

I guess to be more clear the main problem is I have no idea how to demo the product. On slack it clearly guides you to "Create a workspace" or "Find workspaces you can join" .... on zulipchat.com it says "Find Accounts" which on entering the site for the first time makes no sense to me instead of something like a Try ZulipChat link to chat.zulip.org or another realm that serves Demoing customers.
That's true; our CTA is see plans and pricing, which we should reconsider.
and yeah, I think starting with a gif loop makes sense, since that's a pre-req for the interaction in any case :).
